Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2011 06:33AM orlandpark65 wrote: I couldn't believe the Whitehouse has pink lights shining on it. Really!!   Im sick of hearing about "get your mamogram" early detection ..... I've been going every year for mamo's since I was 38 and the mamogram didn't show the BC until is was way advanced.    Have any of you heard the new Martina McBride song, it's brutal, I heard 1 line and was crying.  My cousin watched the Youtube video and told me to stay away.    Sorry for sounding so cranky, better get my coffee now.   Have a great day!
Posts.Title: What to do about pinktober...yuch.. weesa Celtic_Spirit

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2011 11:09AM orlandpark65 wrote: I know it's only October 7th, but I figure if you can't beat them join them.  I'm doing my first walk on Oct 16th and scared.   Don't want to get all emotional.  My entire family is doing it and I can't believe I raised almost $1000.00.   I feel like I'm "coming out of the closet".    I've done everything to hide this and I'm not sure why.  I should wear it like a badge of honor but I guess I don't like any sympathy looks or attention.
Posts.Title: What to do about pinktober...yuch.. weesa Celtic_Spirit

Posts.Content: Jul 5, 2011 11:38AM orlandpark65 wrote: Im on my second week and feel pretty good.    I had the family over for the 4th of July.   Bit tired today but  nothing out of the usual.   The first day of RAD I had to lay there for about an  hour with my arms over my head and couldn't move. That was tough. Mind over matter.  Wish I knew would of took a xanex.  Mapping you can't move and arms over head too!   Good luck you will get through this too!
Posts.Title: July 2011 rads Merilee jankc

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 11:53AM orlandpark65 wrote: The hospital that I go to offer massage and acupuncture as part of  treatment.

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2012 10:34AM orlandpark65 wrote: I was dx 1-11-11, not a long timer, but similar dx to you except I had way more nodes.  I'm doing well. On tamoxifen that's okay, minor joint pain.  Had all my plastic surgery and that went well.  Just need to get my tattoo next month.  Trying to get motivated to diet and exercise more.  If you have any questions, please let me know.  Good luck, this too shall pass.

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2012 06:27AM orlandpark65 wrote: Thanks for posting.  Damn nodes!  I'm doing well.  I just booked a trip to California for spring break. We live in Chicago.  I have always been a good saver or I would put my money into our house. Didn't travel much.  Not anymore.  I've always wanted to go to California so me and the family are going from San Fran down to LA for a weeks vacation in  a few weeks.   This has changed my outlook on alot too, for the better.  Now I'm trying to figure where to go next.  Have a great day!

Posts.Title: Positive nodes with long term survival many Lily55

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2012 04:34AM orlandpark65 wrote: Fran  wow your Oncologist is a downer.   Mine never said anything like that to me.  Always positive.  Who knows what the future will bring, I agree with getting hit by a car, lol etc.  Don't worry til it's time to worry, that is what my mother use to say. It helps
Posts.Title: Positive nodes with long term survival many Lily55

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2011 10:57AM orlandpark65 wrote: I actually paniced yesterday because I went to a family party, had beef, pasta, cake and oh yeah salad and a diet coke.   I thought OMG this is why I got bc it's the way I eat.  Then I laid on my couch and watched everyone run, walk, bike past my house.   I need to get motivated to excersize.  Radiation is knocking me out though.   I have incorporated more veggies and fruit and cutting back on meat. Do you think if I just gradually make changes that's okay? I just love sugar....why is it so bad....bummer.   Wish beans were as good.

Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2011 01:09AM orlandpark65 wrote: Thanks for the positive stories.   I have stopped telling people "how many nodes"  I'm sick of the "Oh my God!" comments.  I'm treating my stage and nodes as my weight   I LIE big time.  LOL...
Posts.Title: Positive nodes with long term survival many Lily55

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2011 01:16PM orlandpark65 wrote: It took me a while. Hate the "sad face"  The questions are awful and catch you off guard.   Someone told me to treat your stage and lymphnodes like your weight.   LIE.......most people don't understand and are not educated enough like we are.
Posts.Title: How do you answer "did they catch it early?" oaktownmom 208sandy

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 12:14PM orlandpark65 wrote: That is  totally normal feeling to have.   Why me....why couldn't I be stage 1 or even 2....why...why..why.  As momine said anyone can have a recurrence.  Cancer has it's own agenda.    Today is my 1 year anniversary, things do get better.  You are still processing and accepting this, don't be hard on yourself.
Posts.Title: Why am I only ok talking to stage III ladies?feeling like a jerk Josiekat lkc

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2012 01:17PM orlandpark65 wrote: It dawned on me that Cancer has it's own agenda no matter what your dx is.  I work with a girl, stage I no nodes and it came back so who in the heck knows.   I try to tell myself, it's just a number....yeah right who am I kidding.  lol
Posts.Title: Why am I only ok talking to stage III ladies?feeling like a jerk Josiekat lkc

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2011 02:32PM orlandpark65 wrote: You should call your doctor. My onc said that if it's non stop pain and doesn't go away to call and meet with him.   I just scheduled a massage.   I go to Northwestern Hosp in Chicago and they offer 5 free messages to breast cancer patients.  Taking advantage of that.  I'm hoping that will cure all my pains.  I thinks most of it is stress related.
